name: politico
text:
When Ruth Bader Ginsburg wanted to be Supreme Court clerk in 1960, she was rejected because of her gender. More than 30 years later she made it to the high court bench herself. 

Here‚Äôs a look back Ginsburg‚Äôs life and legacy. üëá

name: politico
text:
Throughout her life and career, Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was a champion for women‚Äôs rights and equality.

When President Bill Clinton nominated her for the Supreme Court, he called Ginsburg ‚Äúthe Thurgood Marshall of gender equality law‚Äù https://t.co/5fQwhVyXCS https://t.co/PMUWhfCBGS

name: politico
text:
Ginsburg blazed her way into the legal profession, fighting for women's rights the entire way, including in a landmark Supreme Court case
https://t.co/GkIgXOTTM7 https://t.co/RblqPttWQU

name: politico
text:
Reminder: Here's Trump's SCOTUS shortlist. It's headlined by Republican Senators Ted Cruz, Tom Cotton and Josh Hawley.

name: politico
text:
Of the six gender-discrimination cases Ginsburg argued in front of an all-male Supreme Court bench the 1970s, she won five
https://t.co/GkIgXOTTM7 https://t.co/oO7fzftAG9

name: politico
text:
In 1980, President Jimmy Carter picked Ginsburg for the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit
https://t.co/wpaug20gJD

name: politico
text:
Ginsburg made it to the nation's highest court in 1993, after being confirmed by a vote of 96-3. She was just the second woman ever to become a Supreme Court justice.
https://t.co/GkIgXOTTM7 https://t.co/viZIn2YcTx

name: politico
text:
Though tagged as a liberal, Ginsburg was an advocate for judicial restraint
https://t.co/GkIgXOTTM7 https://t.co/ZFo2Jf16UZ

name: politico
text:
As the frequency and barbed tone of her dissents increased later in her career, she became a liberal icon, sometimes dubbed ‚ÄúThe Notorious RBG‚Äù
https://t.co/GkIgXOTTM7 https://t.co/obVbDvO8oM

name: politico
text:
